title: Free Child (Short Film)
description:
Thanks to Google for sponsoring this film. Learn more about Search here: https://www.google.com/search/howsearchworks/

This Film is dedicated to my father, @wimhof1 & @WillSmith 


VISION BY: Ammar Kandil & Kate Ward 

WRITTEN & DIRECTED BY: Taylor Jenisch & Mads Beier [https://www.instagram.com/burning.boat/]

COMPOSED BY: Bennett Jenisch & Moth Vegas [https://www.bennettjenisch.com/]

GRAPHIC DESIGN BY: Anton Darri P√°lmarsson

ADDITIONAL THANKS TO: Waqas Naveed, volca123, Robin Watson, RJ Alli for Egypt footage and my dear friend Imen Haddad for the South Africa footage. 
Photography by: Eleshwa Fahmy (@visionsofele) 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hello friends, 

What a journey it's been to get here!! From leaving Egypt exactly 10 years ago, this month, to almost dying a month ago in a car accident. This film is about the journey in between and the massive role the internet played in my life. I dedicate this film to the free child in each of us to dream the biggest and wildest we can. 

And on a personal note, thank you to every single person who saw me, loved me and challenged me along the journey. 

All my love, 
Ammar
 (@ammar)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hey Guys, 
Burning Boat here! We couldn‚Äôt be more grateful for being given the opportunity to work on another Yes Theory project and especially one so personal to Ammar. Tomorrow we're releasing a super interesting in-depth podcast, featuring Ammar, about the process of making this film, so stay tuned for that! A huge thanks to everyone who helped make this project a reality!

title: ABANDONED DISNEYLAND FOUND IN JAPAN (very creepy) | Yes Theory
description:
On our trip to Japan, we encountered one of the creepiest places in the country: Nara Dreamland, the abandoned amusement park that was based on Disneyland. It was built in 1961, closed in 2006, and was finally demolished on 2016.

Hope you enjoy it!

Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. title: Time to Change.
description:
There are many necessary steps that need to be taken to create a more juste and fair world. Showing up at the protests and making your voices heard is a great first step, but showing up to vote BOTH locally and on a state level (where many decisions that affect our daily lives are made) as well as on a federal level, might not be the most glamorous way we create change. But bit by bit, we will find and elect the leaders we need.

We are not running any ads on this video and as of writing this, our clothing line Seek Discomfort has raised over $40,000 for the Black Lives Matter organization.

We highly recommend watching "The 13th" documentary about the prison system in America. It was recently posted for free on YouTube and is an amazing opener of just a small portion of the systemic racism this country experiences to this day:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=krfcq5pF8u8

Drone footage courtesy of @loubaldanzaproductions

We have a 2nd channel! Make sure to subscribe to it here:

title: (ANGRY HOOLIGANS) Starting a CHANT With Football's CRAZIEST Fans | Yes Theory
description:
All music from Epidemic Sound (free 30 day trial): http://share.epidemicsound.com/wFFbr 

Camera: Sony A7S Mark ii

Millwall Football is notorious for having the craziest fans. Based in the UK, this football team has experienced 100 years of hooligans, fist fights, deaths and riots. So of course, we wanted to see what it was all about. We were in London back in September, and hopped on a train to Millwall to try and join the hooligan section and start a chant. Let's just say we we were freaking out the entire time. The only way to blend in was to be the craziest person there. Hope you enjoy :)

Who are we? 
Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. Ammar, Thomas, Matt and Derin met in Montreal, Canada in the summer of 2015 and bonded over their shared desire to live a life that challenged and excited them. Fast forward to a year later, the team is now based out of Los Angeles, making a show on Snapchat Discover.

title: SNEAKING INTO THE WORLDS BIGGEST ABANDONED MALL (NOOSE found!) | Yes Theory
description:
We snuck into the biggest abandoned mall in California with friends. It was dangerous, there was security, and we probably don't recommend you try this.

Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. Ammar, Thomas, Matt and Derin met in Montreal, Canada in the summer of 2015 and bonded over their shared desire to live a life that challenged and excited them. Fast forward to a year later, the team is now based out of Los Angeles, making a show on Snapchat Discover every Sunday on the Brother Channel.

title: 365 DAYS OF DISCOMFORT - Yes Theory Rewind 2019
description:
Seek Discomfort isn't just jumping out of helicopters and climbing a freezing mountain in shorts. It's about identifying what you need in your life and actively pursuing that fear or discomfort in the name of growth, fulfillment, and adventure.

This year was extremely eventful for us and we just want to take a moment to thank our community and express how infinitely grateful we are for all of you. We've learned so much this year and cannot wait to see what 2020 has to bring.

See you in 2020!!

title: Taking a Syrian Family Back Home After Dictatorship Fell (fled 14 years ago)
description:
If you‚Äôre struggling, consider therapy with our sponsor. Click https://betterhelp.com/yestheory for a discount on your first month of therapy.

Syria's 55 year-old dictatorship fell in December of 2024, changing the entire nation's modern history. After 14 years away, we travel back to Syria with a Yes Fam family Tarek and Alia to re-visit their old home that was miraculously still intact from the war. This time both Thomas and Ammar got to travel there together in one of the most powerful trips we've ever had.

Who are we? 
We believe life‚Äôs greatest moments and deepest connections exist outside your comfort zone.

description:

title: We Created a $70,000 Internet Talent Show
description:
We are giving 7 of you watching right now $70,000... Send us your submissions here: https://livingroomsgottalent.com/
Nominate a friend you think should participate! #LivingRoomsGotTalent 

A few weeks ago we won $70,000 in a Mr. Beast Hide and Seek Challenge. And since that point we've been trying to find ways we could use it for both positivity and giving back during these confusing and stressful times. So, we decided to launch Living Room's Got Talent to celebrate all of you at home. Nominate a friend and find something fun you can do at home! Looking forward to seeing all of your creativity.

title: We Became MALE STRIPPERS (Magic Mike) | Yes Theory
description:
Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/yestheory/

In order to really test our public performance skills, we went to a place where we were definitely going to stand out from the rest of the crowd. And to do that, we had to rip our shirts off...

Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. title: The Desert Nomads (Egyptian Bedouins)
description:
They may be the happiest people we've ever met. For part 4 of our Egypt series we went far off into the desert by the Red Sea, and spent time with these incredibly kind people who have been living in the deserts for thousands of years. They've never lived in cities, have never experienced pollution, and spend every night by a fire under the stars. Not a bad life :) 

Let us know what you think!

title: GET A LIKE FROM THE GUY WHO LAUNCHED THE LIKE BUTTON | YES THEORY
description:
We wanted to see how hard it would be to get the guy who launched the "Like" button for Facebook to like our page on Facebook.

One of our favorite adventures by far. 

Jared Morgenstern was the third designer to join Facebook. He was also the product manager who launched the the "Like" button for the social network in 2009.

In our episode with Jared, he shared his perspective on the "Like" button and told us some insider stories about the early days of Facebook and his work with Mark Zuckerberg. But it doesn't end there...We made Jared get out of his comfort zone and do something he's never done before. Watch the episode and tell us what you thought!

If you are interested in Jared's story on how he helped create the like button then you should probably click here: https://medium.com/@jjflex/hi-guys-the-like-button-d3b326a111dc#.lapzucr2s

title: 100 Hours Inside Syria's Failed Dictatorship (heartbreaking journey)
description:
We travel back to Syria in 2025 after the regime was toppled.
Thank you to our sponsor Saily: Get an exclusive 15% discount on Saily data plans. Use code YESTHEORY at checkout. Download Saily app or go to https://saily.com/yestheory

Thank you to the amazing humans who were a part of this:
Ghaidaa:
https://www.instagram.com/ghaidaa_the_guide

Touma:
@ToumaBittar 

Cory:
https://www.instagram.com/cory.s.martin

And of course Ghaidaa and Fadi's tour company for helping us with permits and access everywhere. Reach out to them if you're planning to go to Syria:
https://www.instagram.com/golden.team.syria/

This is one of the hardest stories we've ever had to tell. Experiencing Syria today, speaking to both our Christian Syrian friend Touma and our Palestinian/Syria friend Ghaidaa, we learned what life was truly like growing up here.

We know many parts in here will be shocking, thought provoking or hard to swallow for many, but we feel responsible to share this story after what we experienced and heared.

Our intention here is to share real-life witness stories of our friends we've learned to love and through that to shed light on the realities of our world today.

A few days after we left, revenge attacks were committed against people of the Alawite Sect and Christians, which we were devastated to see. Although some are celebrating their recent freedom, many are living in fear in the country today and we pray that peace will ultimately prevail in the country and between all in the region.

As humans, we deserve a world of peace. We've spent too many years in wars causing generational damage to entire populations, and it's still happening today in Gaza and the West Bank. May we come to our senses and demand peace from our leaders.

Many will interpret a call for peace as a political statement, that is for you to decide. We just do not believe that violence especially against tens of thousands of civilians is the path to any sort of long-term solution.

Sending love to all of you watching this story today. And may peace find you wherever you are.

Who are we? 
We believe life‚Äôs greatest moments and deepest connections exist outside your comfort zone.

title: How We Became Yes Theory!!
description:
This is the story of how we travel for free and do what we love for a living. We generally don't talk much about money, but in this case we figured it was important to share how we survive off what seems like just a YouTube channel. Hope you enjoy :)

If you want to support us, we have merch and we'd really appreciate if you gave it a look :) https://www.fanofafan.co/collections/yes-theory-merch

All music from Epidemic Sound. You can get your free 30 day trial here: http://share.epidemicsound.com/wFFbr 

Our secrets, behind the scenes thoughts and lessons learned, all here: www.yestheory.com/newsletter

Who are we? 
Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. Ammar, Thomas, Matt and Derin met in Montreal, Canada in the summer of 2015 and bonded over their shared desire to live a life that challenged and excited them. Fast forward to a year later, the team is now based out of Los Angeles, making a show on Snapchat Discover.

title: THE YES THEORY ORIGIN - How We Turned Our Lives Around in 30 Days
description:
Welcome to Yes Theory. We spent the month of July 2015 pushing ourselves out of our comfort zones by trying things we'd never done before. And our lives would never be the same again.

PS - For those that are wondering, we all had part time jobs to pay for rent/fund the show.

title: 10 Things NOT To Do in a SELF-DRIVING CAR | Yes Theory
description:
DISCLAIMER: We've driven and tested the self driving feature for over 1,300 miles before and know it's limitations. We strongly advise AGAINST reproducing any of these stunts and even though it might appear otherwise we could extreme precautions to prevent any potential harm of others.
DISCLAIMER 2: *THIS IS NOT AN AD FOR TESLA NOR WERE WE PAID BY TESLA*

SHARE the love! And SUBSCRIBE for more.

We rented out a Tesla for the day and pushed the limit on the "self-driving" feature. The self driving feature is NOT perfect, please do not try to replicate this video. We took a lot of precautions behind the scenes.

Enjoy!

Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. Ammar, Thomas, Matt and Derin met in Montreal, Canada in the summer of 2015 and bonded over their shared desire to live a life that challenged and excited them. Fast forward to a year later, the team is now based out of Los Angeles, making a show on Snapchat Discover every Sunday on the Brother Channel.

title: Love Over Fear
description:
Hi! Usually on this channel we get out of our comfort zone and do things we've never done before. But this week, we had to share a bigger message... We're Ammar, Thomas, Matt and Derin and are from 4 different countries and were particularly affected by the ISIS terror attacks from these past few weeks.

At a desperate time, we felt like the most important thing to remember is that we let them win if we divide ourselves... As people we have to stay strong and stay together.

Love to you all.

title: Spontaneous OVERNIGHT Trip to the Desert (Joshua Tree) | Yes Theory
description:
Song at the end:
Chris Yonge - Killa (feat. bells)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PeSpIrQVWk4 

All other music from Epidemic Sound: http://share.epidemicsound.com/wFFbr 

Drone: DJI phantom 4 pro+
Camera: Sony A7S Mark ii

It was Matt's 25th birthday and at 9 pm at night we randomly decided to drive 3 hours to Joshua Tree and camp out there overnight. It was a spontaneous decision that like so many, was so freaking worth it. 

Joshua Tree is an iconic National Park in California and we'd definitely put it at the top of our list of places to go here. It was unreal.

Who are we?

title: We Met the #1 Sumo Wrestler in the World (with Samurai Haircuts...)
description:
Last year when we were in Japan we met Asash≈çry≈´ Akinori, often considered the greatest sumo wrestler of all time. People call him the Michael Jordan of sumo wrestling. We managed to get a meeting with him and this was days after we had gotten those crazy samurai haircuts, so it was all such a weird and hilarious situation. Hope you enjoy what ends up happening! title: HOW I CRASHED a HOLLYWOOD Premiere - LA LA LAND OSCARS 2017
description:
Original video where we crashed the premieres of Arrival and La La Land:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RElmOeyx7Fk

Thomas' instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thomasbrag/

Back in November we crashed the premieres of Arrival and La La Land who are both nominated for Best Picture at the Oscars 2017. Here's how we did it. But remember, the point of this is NOT to ruin anyone's night or make fun of anybody. Many seats at these Hollywood premieres are empty so we thought we'd take the opportunity to fill some of them!

Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. title: Laughing HYSTERICALLY in public... (surprised a fan)
description:
Markian's awesome channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCi1ynaf3mWz-mgim7LvqjzQ

Our friend Markian helped us surprise a Yes Fam member, Sammy. We decided that together, we'd do the most uncomfortable thing we could think of: laughing out loud as hard as we could, in public. We did it around the USC Campus. It was hilarious, awkward and amazing all at the same time. And Sammy killed it! We had such a blast. Hope you enjoy!

title: YOU Can Change YOUR LIFE For $0
description:
Here it is! The final part of our 5 Part Series is here and it's about YOU. It's easy to think that you can only have fun once you make enough money but what we've learned in our last two years together is that it is truly possible to have an incredible time with no money. So many of the adventures we've been on have required $0 and just some creativity and ridiculousness. So, we hope this inspires you to go out and chase adventure without waiting till your older or you have this or that. Go, now!

Subscribe to our newsletter to figure out our secrets, what we've learned and what we think you should know: www.yestheory.com/newsletter

title: SHE QUIT THE U.N. TO SELL A SHOW TO NETFLIX
description:
Produced, directed and edited by Yes Theory.  Powered by Shopify.

Vandana's show "We Speak Dance" is NOW OUT on Netflix.  Check it out!

Follow your dreams, start today. Enjoy a 30-day free trial with Shopify: https://www.shopify.ca/?ref=yes-theor...

 Vandana's instagram: https://www.instagram.com/vandanahart

At Yes Theory, we make videos about experiences that get us out of our comfort zone to show people the value of saying YES. In this new series, we are behind the camera to feature other peoples' incredible stories of saying yes and the impact that it created in their lives. Make sure you subscribe to keep up with the weekly episodes.

What is Yes Theory?

We believe in challenging what society considers normal. So we seek discomfort to find our own way and fulfill our true calling. And we make videos about it.

Business Inquiries: partnerships@yestheory.com
Fan Feedback: https://www.tribute.co/yestheory/

Merchandise: https://www.fanofafan.co/collections/...

If you want to send mail:

Vertical Networks / Yes Theory
616 Hampton Drive
Los Angeles, California
90291

Who is Vandana?

Vandana Hart is creator and host of We Speak Dance, airing on Netflix global Jan 1 2018, a documentary series using dance as an international language to connect people across cultures.

While advising the UN on Women's Rights she was also a judge on "So You Think You Can Dance" in Africa. She found dance was the most powerful way to unite people, transform lives and act as a weapon for social change. Vandana has traveled to over 80 countries for speaking engagements, leading workshops, choreographing music videos and creating events. 
 
Her training includes Alvin Ailey, global affairs at NYU and London School of Economics.

title: WE JUST GOT 421,726 SUBSCRIBERS IN 48 HOURS.
description:
Thank you for all the love and support from our first episode that we aired on Snapchat! We got over 420,000 Snapchat subscribers to our show in less than 48 hours. That number alone blows our minds, so thank you thank you thank you.

As part of this announcement, we wanted to do our second ever Q&A :) We decided we'd hop in a car and drive to our friend's house in the Hollywood Hills who is up to some cool stuff.

Follow us on twitter for those exclusives! www.twitter.com/yestheory

Subscribe to our newsletter to figure out our secrets, what we've learned and what we think you should know: www.yestheory.com/newsletter

If you want to support us, we have merch and we'd really appreciate if you gave it a look :) https://www.fanofafan.co/collections/yes-theory-merch

All music from Epidemic Sound. You can get your free 30 day trial here: http://share.epidemicsound.com/wFFbr 

Who are we? 
Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. Ammar, Thomas, Matt and Derin met in Montreal, Canada in the summer of 2015 and bonded over their shared desire to live a life that challenged and excited them. Fast forward to a year later, the team is now based out of Los Angeles, making a show on Snapchat Discover.

title: The Untold Story of a Rockstar
description:
Link to Until The Ribbon Breaks Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/0PFM64sKw3GG4Sk8kqNIcp#_=_ 

Link to Until the Ribbon Breaks YouTube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Aqv2xlstdM4

Full Album coming out soon: https://untiltheribbonbreaks.lnk.to/selftitled

Until The Ribbon Breaks is our favorite band and several months ago, through a friend, we met its frontman, Pete Lawrie-Winfield.

One day, he sat down with us in our backyard and told us his story... And we just couldn't keep it to ourselves. The world needed to know not only about his music (which is out of this freaking world) but about what he's been through, what he's learned and the incredible person he's become. 

Thanks for watching.

Follow your dreams, start today. Enjoy a 30-day free trial with Shopify: https://www.shopify.ca/?ref=yes-theor...

At Yes Theory, we make videos about experiences that get us out of our comfort zone to show people the value of saying YES. In this new series, we are behind the camera to feature other peoples' incredible stories of saying yes and the impact that it created in their lives. Make sure you subscribe to keep up with the weekly episodes.

What is Yes Theory?

We believe in challenging what society considers normal. So we seek discomfort to find our own way and fulfill our true calling. And we make videos about it.

title: LOVE OVER FEAR IN REAL LIFE | YES THEORY
description:
Hi! First of all, we'd like to start by thanking you for all of the support on our last video. Our simple message of love, co-existence and tolerance was very important to us and we're happy so many people were touched by it. As the past few days unfolded we realized our video was being watched but we weren't sure if it was being heard. So as a means for YOU to truly choose Love Over Fear, we want you to manifest in real life. Whether it is talking to a stranger at the bus stop, in line at the grocery store or any setting you feel comfortable with. We want you and all of us to realize that EVERYONE is afraid to some degree. Ammar is afraid of people attacking his religion when in fact there are 1.6 billion muslims on the planet exercising their belief peacefully. Matt and Thomas were afraid because they have both lived in Paris and have friends and family that still lives there... If we realize that these attacks affects us all and TALK about it... Maybe, just maybe, we will truly all choose Love Over Fear. Thank you.

Love to you all.

title: Standing out on YouTube
description:
FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/yestheory/

Song: 'Go F*** Yourself' by Two Feet

We spend A LOT of time thinking about originality and creativity on YouTube. We're obviously not claiming that we've got it all figured out but we constantly challenge ourselves creatively and personally to come up with new fresh ideas. Trying to do something different has surprisingly slowed us down on YouTube, but with time it became appreciated and we're going to continue pushing ourselves to become better creators and better human beings. Don't miss out on tomorrow's secret announcement by turning on the post notifications :) also I PROMISE you will be blown away by Sunday's episode. Our backyard has turned into a piece of art. Can't wait to show you.

title: we have some news
description:
Our Instagram: www.instagram.com/yestheory

Alright guys, we've been uploading 2 videos a week for about 8 months in a row now. It's been a crazy ride to sustain since many of our videos take several days to film, but it's been an incredible ride. Our goal is to INCREASE the number of videos we post on this channel with a TON new ideas. The problem is we don't have time to plan out these new ideas right now and we also don't have the editing resources to handle the production value we want to accomplish. SO, we are scaling back to 1 weekly video on Sundays for about 4-6 weeks until we create a sustainable system.. then we'll eventually start scaling up to 2-3 and then potentially more... Lot's of exciting things ahead and we're glad you're coming along with us.

NOW, we're also SO hyped to release 5 Project 30 episodes a week from Monday-Friday on Instagram. They're made to be watched on your phone so Instagram was the perfect home for these episodes. Can't wait to see you there! www.instagram.com/yestheory

Follow us on twitter for those exclusives! www.twitter.com/yestheory

Subscribe to our newsletter to figure out our secrets, what we've learned and what we think you should know: www.yestheory.com/newsletter

title: How YOU can finally JOIN US on an adventure
description:
OK... ANYONE CAN APPLY. We want to hear all the stories even under 18 then we will see :) It's just easier if you're over 18!

Here is the email: yestheorydream@gmail.com

Here are the questions:

1. What city and country do you live in?
2. How old are you?
3. What fear/discomfort do you want to overcome/attempt and how can we help? And WHY? 

Yes Theory are four friends from four different countries who constantly seek discomfort in order to grow. Ammar, Thomas, Matt and Derin met in Montreal, Canada in the summer of 2015 and bonded over their shared desire to live a life that challenged and excited them. Fast forward to a year later, the team is now based out of Los Angeles, making a show on Snapchat Discover every Sunday on the Brother Channel.
